alert.note: Alert for Western Grant; Western Pendleton (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 06 at 11:45AM EST until January 07 at 10:00AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 10 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches, with isolated totals up to 10 inches possible. Northwest winds will increase and gust around 30 to 35 mph Friday morning. Wind chills around -10 to -15 degrees are possible along the ridge tops Friday morning. * WHERE...In Virginia, Western Highland County. In West Virginia, Western Grant and Western Pendleton Counties. In Maryland, Garrett County. * WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 10 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening commute and the Friday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow is expected this evening with snowfall rates around 1-2 inches per hour possible. Visibility will be reduced to below one quarter mile at times in snow and blowing snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. When venturing outside, watch your first few steps taken on steps, sidewalks, and driveways, which could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
